hypothesis_content.title: Cross-Exchange Liquidity Arbitrage After Stress Events
hypothesis_content.statement: Following stress events (VIX > 25, credit spreads widening), price discrepancies between Coinbase and Binance BTC/USD pairs exceeding 0.4% will revert within 30 minutes with >80% probability when aggregate crypto market maker inventory levels are below 30-day average.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Post-liquidity crash, market maker capacity is reduced, allowing larger dislocations. However, during macro stress events, these dislocations are primarily technical rather than fundamental, creating high-probability mean reversion opportunities.
entry_conditions: VIX > 25 OR High-Yield Corporate Bond Spread > 500bps
Market maker inventory levels (estimated from flow data) < 30-day average
Both exchanges showing normal API response times (<200ms)

exit_conditions.stop_loss: Spread widens to >0.8% OR position held >30 minutes

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Spreads >0.4% persist >60 minutes during stress events despite normal exchange operations.
